summary: This is an email chain from November 27, 2019, where Emily Purser Brown, a news editor, inquires with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York about obtaining documents and video evidence from the Guiffre v. Maxwell civil case. The public affairs office responds that it is a civil matter they are not a party to.

persons.name: Emily Purser Brown
persons.context: Journalist inquiring about obtaining court documents and video evidence related to the Guiffre v. Maxwell case involving Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the civil case Guiffre v. Maxwell; the journalist is seeking transcripts of her video statement to the court and the video itself.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the central figure in the case documents the journalist is researching.

connections.description: Maxwell is a defendant in a civil case (Guiffre v. Maxwell) related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Documents Unsealed in Epstein/Maxwell Case
events.description: Court documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein case were unsealed in August 2019.

keyFacts: A journalist was actively seeking Ghislaine Maxwell's video statement to the court from the Guiffre v. Maxwell civil case in late November 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York declined to assist, stating the civil matter was one they were not a party to.
The inquiry references documents unsealed in August 2019 under case number 18-2868, but the sought video evidence was not among them.
The document shows media interest in obtaining Maxwell's direct testimony shortly after the initial document release.
